ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Northern Auroral Electrojet Index at 60 sec Resolution conjugate to Southern Auroral Electrojet Index

RevisionEvent.Note: Updated to SPASE Version 2.3.2 if needed, Applied quality conntrol for DOI usage, LFB

ResourceHeader.Description: The northern auroral electrojet (SAE) index is constructed from 9 ground magnetometers in the northern auroral region. This data set contains a northern auroral electrojet (NAE) index, a northern auroral lower (NAL) index, and a northern auroral upper (NAU) index. Availability of the NAE index may vary from day to day depending upon magnetometer data availabiliy. NAE indices were only produced when data from all stations were available. This data set is nearly conjugate to the SAE index. Details on the magnetometer arrays are available at: Weygand, J.M., and E. Zesta, Comparison of auroral electrojet indices in the Northern and Southern hemispheres, J. Geophys. Res., 113, A08202, doi:10.1029/2008ja013055, 2008.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Dr. E. Zesta; Dr. J.M. Weygand; Geophysical Institute Magnetometer Array; Ground-Based Observatory (GBO) systems for THEMIS; Danish Meteorological Institute; International Real-time Magnetic Observatory; University of Iceland; National Institute of Polar Research

InformationURL.Name: Journal of Geophysical Research article on the Northern and Southern Auroral Electrojet Index
InformationURL.Description: Research Article on the development and first use of the SAE index.

InformationURL.Name: Second Journal of Geophysical Research article on the Northern and Southern Auroral Electrojet Index
InformationURL.Description: Research Article on the development and first use of the SAE index.

Association.Note: Associated with the southern auroral electrojet index.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: Dr. E. Zesta; Dr. J.M. Weygand; Geophysical Institute Magnetometer Array; Ground-Based Observatory (GBO) systems for THEMIS; Danish Meteorological Institute; International Real-time Magnetic Observatory; University of Iceland; National Institute of Polar Research

TimeSpan.Note: Time format in data files is: day, month, year hour, min, seconds. Ex: '01-Jan-1981 00:00:00.000'

Parameter.Name: Universal Time
Parameter.Description: Interpolated universal time columns from left to right are: day month year hour minute sec in the format of dd mm yyyy hh mm ss.

Structure.Description: Universal Time expressed using a 6-column day, month, year, hour, minute, second representation

Parameter.Name: Northern Auroral Electrojet Lower Index
Parameter.Description: These data are the northern auroral electrojet lower index in units of nT at 60 s resolution. These values were determined using the same method as the World Data Center AL index.
Parameter.Caveats: The 5 quitest days were not alway available from the ground magnetometers. The next available quietest day was used instead. Also be aware of spikes in the data from original magnetometer data sets.

Parameter.Name: Northern Auroral Electrojet Upper Index
Parameter.Description: These data are the northern auroral electrojet upper Index in units of nT at 60 s resolution. These values were determined using the same meathod as the World Data Center AU index.

Parameter.Name: Northern Auroral Electrojet Index
Parameter.Description: These data are the northern auroral electrojet index in units of nT at 60 s resolution. These values were determined using the same meathod as the World Data Center AE index.
